credentials.title: Upstream Credentials
credentials.subtitle: Manage upstream provider credentials and track their earnings
credentials.price_multiplier_helper: At {{ratio}}x multiplier, for every $1.00 of upstream API cost, requests will deduct ${{credited}} Credits.
credentials.hint_json_detected: JSON detected — token will be auto-extracted
credentials.hint_access_token: This looks like a temporary access token (expires in ~1 hour). Please use the refresh token instead.
credentials.error_quota_required: This provider requires a manual quota value. Please enter the remaining balance.
credentials.error_secret_format: The key format doesn't match the expected pattern ({{example}}). Please double-check.
credentials.copy_prompt_tooltip: Click to copy a prompt you can paste into your AI IDE or CLI tool to extract the credential automatically.

copy_prompt_text.gemini-cli:
I need to extract my Gemini CLI refresh token from this machine.

1. Read the file: ~/.gemini/oauth_creds.json
2. Extract ONLY the "refresh_token" field value
3. Display the refresh_token value so I can copy it

Security: Do NOT display the full file contents or any "access_token" values — only the refresh_token. The refresh_token typically starts with "1//".
copy_prompt_text.antigravity:
I need to extract my Antigravity IDE refresh token from this machine.

1. Find and read JSON files in: ~/.antigravity_tools/accounts/
2. Extract the nested "token.refresh_token" field value
3. Display the refresh_token value so I can copy it

Security: Do NOT display the full file contents or any access token values — only the refresh_token. The refresh_token typically starts with "1//".
copy_prompt_text.kiro:
I need to extract my Kiro IDE refresh token from this machine.

1. Read the file: ~/.aws/sso/cache/kiro-auth-token.json
2. Extract ONLY the "refreshToken" field value (camelCase, NOT "accessToken")
3. Display the refreshToken value so I can copy it

Security: Do NOT display the full file contents or any "accessToken" values — only the refreshToken. The refreshToken typically starts with "aor".

openrouter: Click "Create" to generate a new API key and copy it
zenmux: Click "Create API Key" and copy it
deepinfra: Click "New API Key" and copy it
deepseek: Create a new API key and copy it
google-ai-studio: Create a new API key and copy it
oaipro: Create a new API key and copy it
openai: Create a new secret key and copy it
qwen-code: Click "获取 Coding Plan API Key" to get the plan-exclusive API key and copy it
gemini-cli: Install Gemini CLI and run `gemini` to sign in with Google
Paste the file contents or just the refresh_token value
antigravity: Open Antigravity IDE and sign in with Google
Paste the file contents or just the refresh_token value
kiro: Install Kiro IDE and sign in with GitHub or Google
Paste the file contents or just the refreshToken value
